Waldron Middle School participated in the National Geographic Bee for its third year in a row. Each year, thousands of schools in the United States participate in the National Geographic Bee using materials prepared by the National Geographic Society. Thirty students from 5th through 8th grade participated in our Bee and were challenged on their knowledge of the world and geographic concepts. The competition consisted of five preliminary rounds, one final round, and a championship round. Our final contestants included Caden Hunt of 7th grade (3rd place) and Kylon Fielding of 7th grade (2nd place). Joseph Rhodes of 5th grade was our Geography Bee champion. Joseph will go on to compete for a spot in the state Geography Bee and has the potential to qualify for the national competition that could result in a trip to Washington, D.C., college scholarships, and a prize trip. We are so proud of our students and teachers who made the WMS Geography Bee possible.
